channel.title: Comparing Two Int Values In Jython Issue
channel.description:
[code=Python] from server.util import ScriptManager
def npc_click1(player): if (player.questsStatus[0] == 0): print("Hi") [/code]
So basically I have an array written in Java defining my players quest status, and I'm trying to compare them here and have it print out "Hi" when its right. (Please note I'm only using these outputs for the purpose of the question)
When I print out the comparison it self, it returns the number 1. When I compare two ints by themselves it also works. I get this error when trying to do the above upon start-up, not when I trigger the method:
[code=Console Output] [7/11/13 6:23 PM]: Exception in thread "main" Traceback (innermost last): (no code object) at line 0 SyntaxError: ('invalid syntax', ('<iostream>', 11, 9, '\tprint("Hi")')) [/code]
Any help?

item.title: Comparing Two Int Values In Jython Issue
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

looks like the if statement is tabbed twice. remove one of them

Read full topic

item.title: Comparing Two Int Values In Jython Issue
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

from server.util import ScriptManager

def npc_click1(player):
	if (player.questsStatus[0] == 0):
	    print("Hi")

So basically I have an array written in Java defining my players quest status, and I’m trying to compare them here and have it print out “Hi” when its right. (Please note I’m only using these outputs for the purpose of the question)

When I print out the comparison it self, it returns the number 1. When I compare two ints by themselves it also works. I get this error when trying to do the above upon start-up, not when I trigger the method:

[7/11/13 6:23 PM]: Exception in thread "main" Traceback (innermost last):
  (no code object) at line 0
SyntaxError: ('invalid syntax', ('<iostream>', 11, 9, '\tprint("Hi")'))

Any help?

Read full topic
item.source: Comparing Two Int Values In Jython Issue
